issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

fields.description:
This is not a new issue but async scheduling makes it worse:

In sync scheduling, if an AM container allocated to a node, it assumes node just heartbeat to RM, and AM launcher will connect NM to launch the container. Even though it is possible that NM crashes after the heartbeat, which causes AM hangs for a while. But it is related rare.

In async scheduling world, multiple AM containers can be placed on a problematic NM, which could cause application hangs easily. Discussed with [~sunilg] and [~jianhe] , we need one fix:

When async scheduling enabled:
 - Skip node which missed X node heartbeat.

And in addition, it's better to reduce wait time by setting following configs to earlier fail a container being launched at an NM with connectivity issue.
{code:java}
RetryPolicy retryPolicy =
    createRetryPolicy(conf,
      YarnConfiguration.CLIENT_NM_CONNECT_MAX_WAIT_MS,
      YarnConfiguration.DEFAULT_CLIENT_NM_CONNECT_MAX_WAIT_MS,
      YarnConfiguration.CLIENT_NM_CONNECT_RETRY_INTERVAL_MS,
      YarnConfiguration.DEFAULT_CLIENT_NM_CONNECT_RETRY_INTERVAL_MS);
{code}

The second part is not covered by the patch.
fields.summary: Improve Capacity Scheduler Async Scheduling to better handle node failures

Thanks [~leftnoteasy] for the patch.

Few comments:
 # {{schedulerNode.notifyNodeUpdate();}} is invoked from scheduler once the node update event is processed from scheduler dispatcher. is it a bit late? could we do update from ResourceTrackerService or RMNodeImpl itself for better accuracy.
 # Could we rename {{AsyncScheduleAMRescheduleThread}} to something like {{AMContainerRescheduleThread.}}
 # {{Skip node which missed 2 heartbeats}} Do you think we can log it to know why such a node is skipped? May be via ActivityTracker?
 #  In {{AsyncScheduleAMRescheduleThread}} do we need a lock (readLock) for accessing node related informations. Also will this AM container killing result in max-am-limit penalty? Since event is killed, it might. I will cross check again.
Thanks [~sunilg] for reviewing the patch, addressed comments and uploaded ver.3 patch.

Hi [~leftnoteasy], 

v3 patch is not uploaded. Cud u pls help to check.
[~sunilg], my bad, just uploaded ver.3 patch.
